intro: Spiranthes saccata, commonly known as the piney swamp twayblade, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like foliage and its unique, spiral-shaped flower clusters. The plant typically grows in wet, acidic habitats such as bogs and pine forests. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Spiranthes saccata is a perennial herb that plays a role in maintaining the ecological balance of its wetland environment.
